meanings.definition: Uttered the interjection "oh" in surprise or realization.
meanings.sent2: I ohed when I saw the magician's trick.
meanings.sent3: The cat ohed when it saw a cucumber behind it.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm ohed loudly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The child ohed with delight at the surprise party.

meanings.definition: Reacted with an exclamation of "oh" in response to something unexpected.
meanings.sent1: Ohed! I didn't see that coming!
meanings.sent2: She ohed in shock when she heard the news.
meanings.sent3: The dog ohed when it saw a squirrel stealing its food.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks ohed brightly in the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The audience ohed collectively at the plot twist in the movie.

meanings.definition: Made a sound of surprise or understanding by saying "oh".
meanings.sent1: I ohed when I realized I had forgotten my keys.
meanings.sent2: The students ohed in unison at the teacher's announcement.
meanings.sent3: The bird ohed as it flew into a glass window.
meanings.sent4: The clock ohed with each passing hour.
meanings.sent5: The baby ohed cutely at the sight of a balloon.
